refnamediv.refpurpose: Modify an XML document by inserting new children before the node specified by given entity.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
The function modifies the XML document of the given source
XML tree entity by adding new siblings to the node specified by the entity. Siblings will be added right before the node. The source
entity should be XML tree entity, not "persistent XML" entity. The value of source
should be a node entity; source
can not be an attribute entity or a root entity.

The values passed in parameters insertion1
... insertionN
will be converted into XML nodes according to rules described in section Composing Document Fragments From DOM Function Arguments.

After calling the function, parameter source
is still a valid XML entity that points to the same node. The value passed as source
can be used in the rest of caller procedure.

refsect2.title: source
refsect2.para:
The XML tree entity whose document should be modified. This document should not be locked (see Changing XML Entities in DOM Style
for details).

refsect2.title: parameterI
refsect2.para:
The value to be added as as child node of source
.

example.title: XMLInsertBefore in a Virtuoso/PL procedure
example.para:
The sample procedure contains two calls of XMLInsertBefore
. First call insert two new element nodes just before the given node; second call demonstrates how text nodes can be merged.
